intro: Cynanchum fimbriatum, commonly known as the fringed milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which is characterized by its milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are palmately divided, and its flowers are clustered in umbels, producing a distinctive appearance. Cynanchum fimbriatum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
